coco s snowflakes stash yarn or #4 weight yarn crochet hook size 6/7 or smaller abbreviations chain chain pm place marker slip_stitch slip_stitch st stitch 2dc 3dc double_crochet in same space twice three times pattern ch4 and slip_stitch into 1st st to form a ring row 1 ch3 pm into 3rd chain 1dc in center of ring ch2 *2dc in center of ring ch2* repeat from * * 5 more times 6 sets of double_crochet total slip_stitch into 3rd chain from beginning of the round where you placed the sm to join in the round row 2 ch3 this will be your first double_crochet pm in 3rd chain 1dc in ch2 space from row 1 directly beside first ch3 from this row ch3 *3dc in next ch2 space from row 1 ch3* repeat ** 5 more times 1dc in ch2 space from row 1 beside first ch3 from this row slip_stitch in sm to join in the round row 3 *slip_stitch into space from row 2 between dc2 and dc3 from previous round ch3 slip_stitch in open ch3 space from row 2 ch5 slip_stitch in same open space ch7 slip_stitch in same open space ch5 slip_stitch in same open space ch3 slip_stitch in first double_crochet space between dc1and dc2 from row* repeat * * 5 more times join round with slip_stitch cut yarn and weave in loose ends to stiffen snowflakes 2 cups cold water 1 cup at beginning and 1 cup at the end 2 tbsn corn starch combine 1 cup cold water and corn starch in bowl stir over medium heat until mixture thickens remove from burner add 1 cup cold water and stir add snowflakes to mixtures and squeeze out excess liquid place snowflakes on to blocking board or towel and pin to shape until dry
